subject: Gardening
title: How Plants Smell
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: How Plants Smell.

hook.text: Dodder vine can smell a tomato plant nearby and grow toward it. Plants have a sense of smell.

buildup.text: Plants release volatile organic compounds (VOCs) that other plants detect through receptor proteins.

punchline.text: A brainless vine can sniff out its favorite meal.

quiz.question: How does dodder vine locate its preferred host plant?
options: It grows randomly until it contacts a host by chance
It detects volatile chemical cues released by nearby plants
It follows underground root signals through the soil
